intro: Saglorithys axillaris, commonly known as the axillary saglorithys, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four to five petals, and are arranged in inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks.
